document.masterDocTitle: On the Nazeris fauna of Zhejiang, China (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Paederinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the Nazeris fauna of Zhejiang, China (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Paederinae)

Comparative notes.
Nazeris rougemonti
can be separated from the other two species from Tianmushan by the larger body size and the quite different aedeagus: ventral process distinctly widened near apex in ventral view( Figs. 19–21 ).

Distribution and habitat data. The species was found in several localities in northwest Zhejiang . The specimens were collected by sifting leaf litter at altitudes of 300–1325 m , partly together with
N. minor
,
N. chinensis
and
N. sadanarii
.
